channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OK
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OK

item.title: Report X-2024060886
item.description:
Report X-2024060886

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-09
  • City: MUSKOGEE
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1998
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Car was found to be leaking during movement and was set out to the Rip track. Upon inspection it was determined that the rupture disc was blown, and the cover/cap was missing. The cable connecting the cover/cap to the trivent assembly was frayed. The disc gave evidence of a surge that ruptured the disc in an outward direction. I was unable to determine if a surge protector was present. The disc was replaced, and the shipper was advised to get an MRU to replace the cover/cap and have the car requalified.

item.title: Report I-2024060020
item.description:
Report I-2024060020

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-15
  • City: Guthrie
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: APEX EXECUTIVE JET CENTER INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3600
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The delivery truck was pumping from the tanker to our storage tank. The overfill system failed to operate and the spill occurred. Called Environmental Management, Inc. to clean up the released material. Released fuel stayed inside concrete containment.
